string-array.name: help_texts
string-array.item: On Watch displays a selection of useful information for a sailing watchkeeper, and sounds chimes and alerts to keep you on your toes. It also lets you know about interesting astronomical phenomena to look out for on those long night watches.

On Watch has several display pages, each one showing a different kind of information. At the bottom of the screen, you will see "left" and "right" buttons, which you can use to flip between the pages.\n\ \n\ The following sections describe each of the pages in detail.

The device's "menu" button pops up a menu containing a number of options:
\ • Settings takes you to the settings screen; see "Settings" below.
\ • Help displays this help.
\ • About displays an about box, with links to the license and the project home page.
\ • Disclaimer re-displays the one-time warning screen.
\ • Exit stops the application.

On Watch has a number of user-configurable options in its Settings screen. This screen is reached through the menu, as described under \"Menu\" above. The available settings are detailed in the following sections.
If you would like more information and help with On Watch, or if you want to to report a bug, there are some on-line resources which may be of interest, as described in the following sections.

string-array.name: help_prefs_texts
string-array.item: Use Nautical Time tells On Watch to set your device\'s timezone automatically, based on your longitude. Note that this affects the entire device, not just OnWatch.
Manual Time Control lets you bump the time using the D-pad / trackball.\n\ \n\ Manual Position Control lets you bump the location using the D-pad / trackball.

string-array.name: help_info_texts
string-array.item: There is a discussion board where you can suggest ideas for On Watch, share experiences and thoughts with other users, and generally waffle. Please note that this group is shared with the other Moonblink projects, so mention On Watch when you post:\n\ \n\ • http://groups.google.com/group/moonblink/topics

If you want to report a bug, you can use the Moonblink Issue tracker. Before you post, please look through the existing issues -- including closed issues -- before raising a new one. Your problem may already have been solved.
\ 
\ If you do need to raise a new issue:
\ • The issue tracker is used by a number of projects. Please click on the "Product-" label to set the product you are reporting against. You can also set the other fields as appropriate.
\ • Please tell me what device, and what version of Android, you are using.
\ • If the bug is a crash, then please attach a log if you possibly can. If you don't know how, don't sweat it.
\ 
\ So, the issue tracker is here:
\ 
\ • http://code.google.com/p/moonblink/issues/list
On Watch is an open project, so if you want to join in and make contributions, you can. See the project page for information:\n\ \n\ • http://code.google.com/p/moonblink/wiki/OnWatch
